title: Unable to log in to Gmail
content: Since Thunderbird automatically updated to the Supernova version,I keep getting asked to log in to my Gmail account. I provide my email address and password, then am meant to receive an SMS on my mobile phone with a verification code. This never arrives even though I must have tried "resending" more than a dozen times. Meanwhile on the same PC, I can open Gmail in Firefox where it shows me as logged on. Can I revert to the previous version of TB or can TB not recognise that I am already logged on to my Google account on this PC? Thanks for any help or advice.

title: Supernova and Yahoo
content: Supernova just did something that previous versions of Thunderbird didn't: It downloaded all the mail in my Yahoo account. Why did it do something I didn't ask it to? I need to know a couple of things: 1) How do I get TB to stop downloading my Yahoo mail? 2) How can I delete the mail TB just downloaded from my Yahoo account without actually losing it in my Yahoo account? A number of years ago, I deleted my Yahoo messages in TB and discovered to my horror that all those messages were deleted from my Yahoo account. (In case I'm not being clear, what I mean is that when I went with my browser to my Yahoo mail page, all my messages were gone.)

title: update to thunderbird 115.3.1 (64-bit) authentication problems
content:
After the update, ALL 7 of my email accounts (Gmail, server, yahoo) respond with "Sending of password for user XXXXX@GMAIL.COM did not succeed. Mail server pop.gmail.com responded: [AUTH] Username and password not accepted." All accounts respond the same, for fetching or sending. I have checked all the server settings in & out, and re-typed them in. The "Enter new password" box does not solve the problem, I get the original error message over and over. 

Running Win10, been using Netscape/Mozilla/Tbird for 25+ years.

I have several other issues with this new version, but if I can't get it to work, they are lower priority.

title: Unable to send emails - 'SSL received a malformed Certificate handshake message'
content:
Hi two separate machines now cannot send emails with Thunderbird (other email programmes unaffected) and receiving AOK. Full message:- Sending of the message failed. SSL received a malformed Certificate handshake message. The configuration related to smtp.fireflyuk.net must be corrected.

Simply anyone know how to sort this (I am mildly technical but not programmer standard) and is this a known issue Mozilla are likely to fix or is it an issue at my email providers end? Thanks
creator: suffolkfox44

title: Thunderbird 115 has no junk removal tool
content:
I am speechless. Thunderbird has made the biggest mistake in all my time in FOSS since 2008. I don't post this because I enjoy it; I've handed out Linux distros at Software Freedom Day. But there comes a point when I have a right to be unhappy even with a free tool.

The previous version of Thunderbird had a button under tools; I could delete all junk emails in one click. THIS IS MY MAIN REASON TO USE THUNDER BIRD. I run a business email and I get so much spam.

But now that tool is gone in Supernova. I am left to deleting ONE junk email at a time which would take hours? Not to mention the safety aspects of this; I need to clean my emails so that my business partner who uses the computer doesn't fall for a scam.

PLEASE PLEASE put this delete junk button under Tools back in. If not I have no choice but to look for a different email client. I can put in my own email sever settings. Fine. I am not asking for an email client that molly coddles me. But this change is ridiculous.

I can not under stand why Supernova has done this.
creator: secretelf77

title: 'Get messages' button in new Supernova

title: Unable to copy HTML-formatted table from Firefox on Linux
content:
When in Firefox, I can copy web site data and it ends up in the HTML clipboard, which I can verify with "xclip -o -t TARGETS" and inspecting the respective text/html target.

However, when I try to paste this HTML-formatted table into an HTML email in Thunderbird, nothing happens, it simply won't insert a single character. Other data (headings, bold fonts, etc.) work just fine, but tables break.

I'm using Thunderbird 102.15.1 (64-Bit).

Any remediation possible?

title: Thunderbird header pane scrolls unpredictably
content:
This problem is intermittent, but frequent.

When I am reading a message in Thunderbird 115.3.1, and I click on the "delete" button, the message will be deleted, but the contents of the header pane (i.e. the pane that's above the message body pane) will scroll unpredictably, by a large amount. I have to manually scroll the header pane to get back to where I was before.

This is happening on Windows 11, and it started happening after Thunderbird did the automatic update to v115, less than 1 week ago.

Ben

title: Several Suggestions.  [was Supernova menus - a bit of a mess]
content:
I've been using Thunderbird as my default mail client since it first came out. It's always been rock solid, and does what I expect of a mail program, manage my home email accounts and nothing more. The design has always been simple and well layed out. I have my folder list on the left, the folder preview/summary on top right, and actual highlighted email on botton right.

The new new menu layout is a bit of a mess. It now sits on the top of the Thunderbird window, above the file/edit/view menu, and can't be moved to below the file/edit/view menu. Every other program follows a defacto standard of default menu ontop, and custom menu's below file/edit/view.

It would be nicer still if I could move this new menu, to sit along side the (Inbox - Local Folders tab), there's all this dead space sitting there. (Where the new tabs sit, when I double click on a email.)

To be honest, where the menu originally sat, (above the message list) was more intuitive, as it applied to task you can apply to messages.

There's also the new "+New Message" button sitting at the top of the Folder Pane, yet the new menu uses "Write" instead of New Message, meaning no consistency. Is it Write or New Message. Also the "New Message" button looks out-of-place sitting there, and both buttons have different text pop-ups. "New Message" has Compose a new message, and "Write" has Create a new message. Again no consistency.

What would make more sense is instead of the "New Message" button sitting at the top of Folder pane, the "Get Messsages" button was there instead, as that has more relevance to the mail folders. (I just noticed that there is a small cloud icon sitting there that is the "Get Messages" button, but as it has no text I've never paid any attention to it, perhaps add some text to it, so that both buttons look like buttons, or both look like Icons. or an option to select text/icon/both.)

Further comment on the New Messages button area (at the top of the Folder pane). The space where that button sits, would be great to add other buttons/icons, ie: Address book, or better still combine the Spaces toolbar into this area, with on/off options for each icon. The spaces toolbar is pointless, a bar that runs the full height of the window for 5 icons.

Trevor..
creator: mozilla457

title: Security Device Manager - OS Client Cert Module
content:
OS Client Cert Module not installed/loaded after clean installation of Thunderbird version 115.3.1. The osclientcerts.dll is present in the Thunderbird program directory. Trying to load the dll in the Security Device Manager does not work.

Is there a way to manually add the security module to the configuration file or registry?

title: Some emails not being marked as read (v118.0.1)
content:
Since installing the new version of ThunderBird I find that some messages are not automatically marked as read immediately. If I wait long enough they do get marked, but if I'm skipping through promotional stuff they just don't get automatically marked as read. Messages that have been sitting in the list unread for a day or two are affected the same as recently arrived messages.

I think it might have something to do with the affected messages containing lots of links, e.g. advertising material from supermarket chains.

In Settings I have "Automatically mark messages as read" - "Immediately on display".
creator: Jay.Dear

title: Thunderbird update 115.3.1 self installed now nothing works
content:
Thunderbird update 115.3.1 self installed now nothing works.

When I first opened program after update and tried to retrieve mail for one account (of5) got a window telling me password not accepted by pop server (at zoho.com) and asking if i wished to enter a new one. Said no and went to passwords in config to check if they had transferred properly. They had.

Tried again to download messages with same results (password not accepted)and clicked to enter new one. Instead window popped up for next account telling me password not accepted by server and did I want to enter a new one. Same results for every account in order without ever letting me access one. Rebooted - no change.

Downloaded copy from mozilla and re-installed thinking it may reconfigure what was wrong. No luck. Now when I try to retrieve messages I don't even get password not accepted only "done" in bottom left corner where it usually shows download happening.

I have used Thunderbird practically since it came out and have installed configured and transferred accounts across many computers and never had any problem like this!
creator: divideweb
